text: Honey never spoils because bacteria can’t grow in it.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
Carrots were originally purple, not orange.
Bananas don’t grow on trees—they grow on giant herbaceous plants.
Potatoes were the first vegetable grown in space.
Cheese is the most stolen food in the world.
Cashews aren’t nuts—they’re seeds that grow outside the fruit.
Chocolate was once used as currency by the Aztecs.
Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas.
Your stomach gets a new lining every 3–4 days to prevent it from digesting itself.
You produce enough saliva in a lifetime to fill two swimming pools.
Your bones are constantly rebuilding; your entire skeleton replaces itself roughly every 10 years.
Your stomach acid is strong enough to dissolve metal.
Octopuses have three hearts.
Sharks existed before trees.
Bees can recognize human faces.
Nintendo started in 1889 as a playing card company.
Nike was originally called Blue Ribbon Sports when it was founded in 1964.
Samsung began in 1938 as a small grocery trading store in South Korea.
Sony’s first product was a rice cooker that didn’t work well, which led them to electronics instead.
Google was originally called ‘Backrub’ because it analyzed backlinks on the web.
Starbucks was named after a character in Moby Dick, not coffee itself.
Lego was originally a wooden toy company before it became the plastic brick empire.
Coca-Cola originally contained cocaine when it was created in 1886.
Facebook was originally called 'TheFacebook' and was only for Harvard students.
McDonald’s once made bubblegum-flavored broccoli to try to get kids to eat healthy.
Nike’s iconic swoosh logo was designed by a student for just $35.
Crayola originally made only 8 colors, including their iconic 'Prussian blue'.
The color red can make objects appear larger or closer in visual perception.
Colors can change how we feel: blue can calm, red can increase heart rate, and yellow can boost alertness.
